common_issues.title: Pieces for Developers: Cloud & Local LLM Connectivity Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties connecting to both cloud-based and locally hosted LLMs within Pieces for Developers. This often manifests as error messages related to cloud service connectivity or issues launching the application. Troubleshooting steps include verifying network connectivity, checking firewall settings, ensuring sufficient system resources for local LLMs, and reviewing Pieces OS logs. Solutions often involve adjusting network configurations, selecting appropriate LLM models, or resolving underlying Pieces OS dependencies.

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## Summary of GitHub issue conversation:

**Key points raised:**

* Rohan Rathi is experiencing issues with Pieces:
    * Cannot make requests to cloud services
    * Having trouble with local models
* Mark, a Pieces support team member, requests logs for investigation.

**Problems identified:**

* Firewall or network configuration issue blocking outgoing requests.
* Potential hardware constraints for local models.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Mark reviewed logs and found an issue with a personal OpenApi key.
* The key was removed, resolving the cloud LLM issue.
* A smaller local LLM model was used, resolving the local LLM issue.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Issues with cloud and local LLMs are resolved.
* Logs reviewed and solutions implemented.

**Additional notes:**

* Rohan provided log files for investigation.
* A call was scheduled for further troubleshooting.
* The call resulted in identifying and resolving the issues.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS was unable to launch
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS was unable to launch
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Ensure core Dependencies ... (retry setup)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8b426c73-aebb-4905-857f-bdee4cad2882)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Problem:** MR-AAYU is experiencing issues launching the Pieces Desktop application.

**Key points:**

* MR-AAYU provided logs upon request.
* It was discovered that MR-AAYU has two installations of Pieces for Developers (Microsoft Store and EXE).
* Pieces OS, a separate application required for Pieces for Developers, appears to be missing logs.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Nathan-courtney-pieces requested additional logs from the Pieces OS installation directory.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue remains unresolved pending the provision of additional logs.

**Additional details:**

* The issue was first reported on Feb 20, 2025.
* MR-AAYU was provided with links to helpful resources and related issues.
* MR-AAYU displayed frustration with the delay in resolution.

related_issues.title: Installing Ollama - Forever
related_issues.text:
Installing Ollama - Forever
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/677e938c-3198-4f1b-af00-b22543704fcc)

I have Ollama installed and this is stuck like this forever. I even tried uninstalling Ollama. Still the same :-(
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* User (waseem852) is experiencing an issue with installing Ollama in Pieces.
* User has tried installing Ollama through various methods, including Piece, manually, and winget, but the issue persists.
* User has restarted Pieces OS and Pieces Desktop, uninstalled and reinstalled Ollama, and even killed both apps through Task Manager.

**Problems Identified:**

* Ollama installation fails regardless of the method used.
* User is unsure what is causing the issue.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Pieces support team member (brian-at-pieces) suggests a call to debug the issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* User agrees to a call and will receive a meeting invite via email. 
* The issue remains unresolved until the call takes place.

**Note:** 
* The conversation ends without a definitive solution.

common_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Connectivity and Linking Issues
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces Desktop app experiencing cloud service connection errors and account linking problems. Solutions include verifying network connectivity, checking firewall settings, using smaller local LLM models, and waiting for new account linking system updates. Support may request logs for troubleshooting.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation


**Key Points Raised:**

* User (@johnkennyuk) experiencing issues with account linking between Github and Google accounts in the Pieces app.
* Current account linking flow is outdated and not working properly.
* New account linking system is currently under development.

**Problems Identified:**

* Existing accounts were registered separately due to bugs in earlier versions of the application.
* Inconsistency in capitalization of email addresses between Github and Google accounts.
* New account linking system not yet available.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Account merging was attempted to resolve the issue.
* Github account was reset for a fresh linking attempt.
* Email privacy settings on Github were temporarily disabled.
* New account linking system is being developed for a late February/early March release.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue not yet resolved due to inconsistencies in email capitalization and the need for the new account linking system.
* User will wait for the new system to be implemented before attempting another account link.
* New system expected to be available in mid-March 2025.

**Other Notes:**

* User expressed interest in being an early tester for the new account linking system.
* Developer confirmed they will reach out to the user when the new system is ready.


## Conclusion

The account linking issue has not been fully resolved yet due to a few remaining issues. However, a new and improved account linking system is currently under development and is expected to be available soon. This new system should address the existing problems and allow for smooth account linking between Github and Google accounts.

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.

- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2

The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## Summary of GitHub issue conversation:

**Key points raised:**

* Rohan Rathi is experiencing issues with Pieces:
    * Cannot make requests to cloud services
    * Having trouble with local models
* Mark, a Pieces support team member, requests logs for investigation.

**Problems identified:**

* Firewall or network configuration issue blocking outgoing requests.
* Potential hardware constraints for local models.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Mark reviewed logs and found an issue with a personal OpenApi key.
* The key was removed, resolving the cloud LLM issue.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Issues with cloud and local LLMs are resolved.
* Logs reviewed and solutions implemented.

**Additional notes:**

* Rohan provided log files for investigation.
* A call was scheduled for further troubleshooting.
* The call resulted in identifying and resolving the issues.

common_issues.title: Ollama Integration Issues with Pieces OS
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with Ollama integration in Pieces OS, including Cuda errors, installation problems, and connectivity issues. These problems may arise from conflicting installations, startup order conflicts, or network configuration problems. Solutions include reinstalling Ollama and Pieces OS, verifying network settings, and using smaller local LLM models.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS conflicting with Installed Ollama Server?
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS conflicting with Installed Ollama Server?
### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces OS instance's Ollama server would always give errors regarding various Cuda dll files not being registered or not found, so I then installed Ollama server from its source which works and Pieces OS could also connect too and use, the problem I'm facing now is that Pieces OS on startup seems to keep starting its own Ollama instance rather than using the externally installed Ollama server instance which means I see the Cuda dll errors again.  My workaround is that I must quit Pieces OS completely then start Ollama server from its own shortcut then start Pieces OS??

Any Ideas??
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: Ollama Installation Issues on Pieces OS

**Key Points Raised:**

* User (johnkennyuk) experienced Cuda errors with Ollama installed on Pieces OS.
* User suspected a bad or corrupt installation of both Pieces OS and Ollama Server.
* User noticed Pieces OS starting before Ollama App, causing issues.
* User proposed detecting an external Ollama instance and preventing Pieces OS from installing its own.

**Problems Identified:**

* Multiple Ollama installations caused conflicts.
* Ollama server started by Pieces OS malfunctioned with Cuda errors.
* Pieces OS startup order might have interfered with Ollama App startup.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* User reinstalled Ollama and Pieces OS multiple times.
* User cleaned up system paths.
* Pieces OS developer pushed a change in version 11.1.2 to address race conditions.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* User reported issue resolved after several reinstalls and path cleanups.
* Issue reoccurred after updates, likely due to race condition.
* Developer proposed a video call to further troubleshoot the problem.

**Additional Notes:**

* User exclusively uses Winget for installations, updates, and uninstalls.
* Issue appeared related to user's system sign-in speed and startup order.
* User suggested improved detection of external Ollama instances by Pieces OS.

common_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Connectivity and Launch Issues
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces for Developers failing to launch or connect to cloud services. Issues often involve firewall configurations, network connectivity, incorrect API keys, or insufficient resources for local LLMs. Solutions include verifying network settings, checking API key validity, using smaller local models, and reviewing logs for detailed error messages.

related_issues.title: Invalid port http://0.0.0.0:null/connect
related_issues.text:
Invalid port http://0.0.0.0:null/connect
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.8 2025-02-17

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces for Developers hangs on first run in third step (Verify Dependency Connections) with error message

unable to open Pieces Core Services
formatexception: Invalid port (at character 16)
http://0.0.0.0:null/connect

Pieces OS seems to work fine, for a brief moment I can see its window with information that the service is active on some port. Then window closes - it is impossible to bring it back, but icon in the  system tray is still there.

How can I set proper port value for Pieces for Developer, and what is the default port value?
## Summary of Pieces Support Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User @mariusz-kowalski is experiencing an issue with the Pieces app on a specific Linux machine.
* He reported a similar issue on another support avenue last week.
* The support bot triaged and routed the issue to the appropriate team member.
* @mack-at-pieces suggests providing the desktop app log file and potentially scheduling a video call for troubleshooting.

**Problems Identified:**

* The user is unable to access specific functionality of the Pieces app on a Linux machine.
* The root cause of the issue isn't immediately clear, but it may be related to the user's specific environment.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* @mack-at-pieces requested the user to share the desktop app log file for diagnosis.
* They also offered to schedule a video call to troubleshoot the issue live.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The user provided the requested log file.
* It remains unclear if a video call was scheduled or if the issue was resolved.

**Additional Notes:**

* The provided information is incomplete as the conversation may continue beyond the provided snippet. 
* Further details might be available in the provided resources and log file.

* Firewall or network configuration issue blocking outgoing requests.
* Potential hardware constraints for local models.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Mark reviewed logs and found an issue with a personal OpenApi key.
* The key was removed, resolving the cloud LLM issue.
* A smaller local LLM model was used, resolving the local LLM issue.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Issues with cloud and local LLMs are resolved.
* Logs reviewed and solutions implemented.

**Additional notes:**

* Rohan provided log files for investigation.
* A call was scheduled for further troubleshooting.
* The call resulted in identifying and resolving the issues.

common_issues.title: JetBrains Plugin and Copilot Issues
common_issues.description: Users report issues with the Pieces for Developers JetBrains plugin, including horizontal scrolling problems in code snippets and cursor visibility in the Copilot chat. Troubleshooting steps include verifying internet connectivity, checking for network restrictions, and ensuring sufficient hardware resources for local LLMs. Solutions involve fixing network configurations, using smaller local models, and addressing plugin-specific bugs.

related_issues.title: Horizontal scrolling doesn't work in JetbRains plugin
related_issues.text:
Horizontal scrolling doesn't work in JetbRains plugin
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, JetBrains

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Horizontal scroll within a code snippet from copilot answer is buggy. I cannot scroll horizontally back and forth to see full line. I need to select text to reach end of line. Once release, my cursor wont appear to scroll left again. Horizontal scrollbar doesn't respond and I cannot select text to left. cursor changes to a drag and drop cursor.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Issue:** 

The user, @dotnetemmanuel, reported an issue where the cursor wouldn't hide when typing in the Copilot chat window.

**Key Points Raised:**

* User reported difficulty typing due to visible cursor in the chat window.
* User provided detailed description of the issue.

**Problems Identified:**

* The cursor remained visible in the Copilot chat window during typing, hindering user experience.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The Pieces support team acknowledged the issue and assigned it to the relevant team members (@mack-at-pieces and @sam-p-at-pieces).
* The team committed to investigate the issue and implement a solution in a future release.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is currently under investigation. 
* The team will provide updates on the progress through this issue.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user was directed to existing issues and Pieces resources for potential workarounds or further information.

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## Summary of GitHub issue conversation:

**Key points raised:**

* Rohan Rathi is experiencing issues with Pieces:
    * Cannot make requests to cloud services
    * Having trouble with local models
* Mark, a Pieces support team member, requests logs for investigation.

**Problems identified:**

* Firewall or network configuration issue blocking outgoing requests.
* Potential hardware constraints for local models.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Mark reviewed logs and found an issue with a personal OpenApi key.
* The key was removed, resolving the cloud LLM issue.
* A smaller local LLM model was used, resolving the local LLM issue.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Issues with cloud and local LLMs are resolved.
* Logs reviewed and solutions implemented.

**Additional notes:**

* Rohan provided log files for investigation.
* A call was scheduled for further troubleshooting.
* The call resulted in identifying and resolving the issues.

recommendations: **Prioritize Ollama Integration Issues:** Allocate additional resources to investigate and resolve Ollama-related issues, as they represent a significant portion of user complaints and exhibit high activity levels.

**Improve Connectivity Troubleshooting:** Develop more comprehensive documentation or troubleshooting guides for connectivity issues, addressing common problems with firewalls, network configurations, and API keys.
**Enhance Account Linking System:** Expedite the development and rollout of the new account linking system to address long-standing user issues and improve the onboarding experience.
**Address JetBrains Plugin Bugs:** Assign developers to investigate and fix the reported bugs in the JetBrains plugin, specifically horizontal scrolling and cursor visibility issues.

**Review Pieces for Developers Launch Process:** Investigate the root causes of launch failures and connectivity errors within Pieces for Developers, potentially focusing on dependency management and error messaging.
**Monitor Pieces OS Startup Order:** Implement measures to ensure Pieces OS and Ollama start in the correct order to prevent conflicts and Cuda errors.
**Gather More Detailed User Feedback:** Encourage users to provide comprehensive logs and system information when reporting issues to facilitate faster diagnosis and resolution.
**Proactively Communicate Known Issues:** Maintain a public-facing list of known issues and workarounds to keep users informed and reduce support ticket volume on recurring problems.
